intro: Delarbrea paradoxa var. macrophylla, commonly known as the giant fern of the Andes, is a striking tropical plant characterized by its large, lance-shaped fronds. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is native to the mountainous regions of South America. The plant features a robust rhizome system that allows it to anchor firmly in rocky or soil substrates. Its fronds can grow up to several meters in length, making it a dramatic addition to botanical gardens. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires consistent moisture for optimal growth.
